about.title: About FaceStyler
about.subtitle: We're on a mission to help everyone find hairstyles that make them look and feel their best.
about.storyP1: Finding the right hairstyle can be frustrating. Many people don't know their face shape, and even if they do, finding hairstyles that actually flatter their features requires hours of research.
about.storyP2: That's why we created FaceStyler - a free, easy-to-use tool that uses AI to detect your face shape and instantly recommend hairstyles that will look great on you. No sign-up required, no hidden fees, and complete privacy.
about.storyP3: Our goal is simple: help you walk into a salon with confidence, knowing exactly what style will flatter your unique features.
about.feature1Desc: Our advanced AI analyzes 468 facial landmarks to accurately determine your face shape in seconds.
about.feature2Desc: Your photos are processed entirely in your browser. They're never uploaded to our servers or stored anywhere.
about.feature3Desc: Each face shape has 15+ handpicked hairstyles, complete with styling tips and maintenance guidance.
about.feature4Desc: No subscriptions, no hidden fees, no premium features. FaceStyler is and will always be free to use.
about.how1Desc: Upload a clear photo of your face or use your camera to take a selfie directly in the app.
about.how2Desc: Our AI processes your photo locally in your browser, analyzing facial proportions to determine your face shape.
about.how3Desc: Browse hairstyles curated specifically for your face shape, filter by style and length, and save your favorites.
about.ctaDesc: It takes less than a minute to discover your perfect hairstyle.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.overviewDesc: At FaceStyler, we take your privacy seriously. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle information when you use our face shape detection and hairstyle recommendation service.
privacy.photoTitle: Photo Processing - Your Privacy is Protected
privacy.photoHighlight: Key Privacy Feature: All photo processing happens entirely in your web browser. Your photos are NEVER uploaded to our servers.
privacy.photoDesc: When you upload a photo or take a selfie using FaceStyler:
privacy.photoPoint1: The image is processed using AI technology that runs locally in your browser
privacy.photoPoint2: No image data is transmitted over the internet to our servers
privacy.photoPoint3: Once you close or refresh the page, the image is immediately discarded from memory
privacy.photoPoint4: We cannot access, view, or store your photos
privacy.analyticsDesc: We use Google Analytics to understand how people use our service. This includes:
privacy.analyticsPoint1: Pages visited and time spent on pages
privacy.analyticsPoint2: Device type, browser, and operating system (non-identifying)
privacy.analyticsPoint4: How you found our website (referral source)
privacy.analyticsNote: This data is anonymous and cannot be used to identify you personally.
privacy.notCollectPoint1: Photos or images of any kind
privacy.notCollectPoint2: Facial recognition data or biometric information
privacy.notCollectPoint4: Email addresses (we don't have accounts or sign-up)
privacy.cookiesDesc: We use cookies for analytics purposes through Google Analytics. These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website. You can disable cookies in your browser settings if you prefer not to be tracked.
privacy.thirdPartyDesc: We use the following third-party services:
privacy.thirdPartyGA: Google Analytics: For anonymous usage analytics
privacy.thirdPartyNote: These services have their own privacy policies that govern how they handle data.
privacy.adsDesc: We display advertisements through Google AdSense. These ads may use cookies to show you relevant content based on your browsing history across different websites. You can opt out of personalized advertising by visiting Google's Ad Settings.
privacy.childrenDesc: FaceStyler is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect any information from children.
privacy.changesDesc: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.
privacy.contactDesc: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us through our website.

footer.brandDesc: AI-powered face shape detection with personalized hairstyle recommendations. Free, no signup required.
footer.connectDesc: Have questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you.

oval.name: Oval
oval.description: The oval face shape is considered the most versatile and well-balanced. It's characterized by a face length that is about 1.5 times the width, with a gently rounded jawline and forehead that are similar in width.
characteristics: Face length is 1.3-1.5 times the width
Forehead and jaw are similar width
tips: You can pull off almost any hairstyle
Avoid covering your forehead too much
Experiment with different lengths and styles
Both side and center parts work well
Try adding volume at the crown for added dimension

round.name: Round
round.description: A round face has soft angles with the width and length being almost equal. The cheeks are usually the widest part of the face, giving it a youthful, friendly appearance.
characteristics: Face width and length are nearly equal
tips: Add height and volume at the crown
Try side-swept bangs to create angles
Long layers can help elongate your face
Avoid chin-length bobs that add width
Opt for styles that create the illusion of length

square.name: Square
square.description: A square face shape features a strong, angular jawline with the forehead, cheekbones, and jaw being roughly the same width. This face shape often conveys strength and confidence.
characteristics: Forehead, cheekbones, and jaw similar in width
Face length and width are nearly equal
tips: Soften angular features with layered cuts
Side-parted styles work beautifully
Add volume at the temples and crown
Avoid blunt, one-length cuts
Soft waves and curls complement your features

heart.name: Heart
heart.description: A heart-shaped face is wider at the forehead and tapers down to a narrow, pointed chin. This creates a romantic, delicate appearance often associated with beauty.
characteristics: Wide forehead, the widest part of the face
Face tapers from forehead to jaw
Often has a widow's peak hairline
tips: Add width at the jaw level to balance
Side-swept bangs soften a wide forehead
Chin-length bobs work wonderfully
Avoid excessive volume at the crown
Layers around the chin add balance

oblong.name: Oblong
oblong.description: An oblong (or long) face shape is longer than it is wide, with the forehead, cheekbones, and jawline being similar in width. The face appears elongated and elegant.
characteristics: Face is noticeably longer than it is wide
Length is more than 1.5 times the width
Forehead, cheeks, and jaw similar in width
May have a long nose or high forehead
tips: Add width and volume at the sides
Bangs can help shorten the appearance of your face
Avoid very long, straight styles
Layered cuts with volume work great
Chin to shoulder length styles are ideal

diamond.name: Diamond
diamond.description: A diamond face shape features high, dramatic cheekbones with a narrow forehead and jawline. This creates an angular, striking appearance that's relatively rare.
characteristics: High, wide cheekbones - the widest point
Face tapers at both top and bottom
tips: Add fullness at the forehead and chin
Side-swept bangs add width at the forehead
Chin-length styles balance the cheekbones
Avoid slicked-back styles
Soft layers around the face work well

oval.question: What haircut is best for an oval face?
oval.answer: Oval faces are versatile and can pull off almost any hairstyle. Popular choices include long layers, blunt bobs, pixie cuts, and shoulder-length waves. The key is to maintain the natural balance of your face shape.

oval.question: Should oval faces have bangs?
oval.answer: Yes! Oval faces can rock most bang styles, from curtain bangs to side-swept or even blunt bangs. Just avoid very heavy, straight-across bangs that cover too much of your forehead, as this can throw off your balanced proportions.

oval.question: What hairstyles should oval faces avoid?
oval.answer: While oval faces are very versatile, you should avoid styles that add too much volume on the sides, which can make your face look rounder. Also, avoid covering your forehead entirely, as this is one of your best features.

oval.question: Is a bob haircut good for oval face?
oval.answer: Absolutely! Bobs are excellent for oval faces. Whether it's a classic chin-length bob, a longer lob, or an asymmetrical bob, this cut complements oval face shapes beautifully.

oval.question: What is the most attractive face shape?
oval.answer: While beauty is subjective, the oval face shape is often considered the 'ideal' face shape due to its balanced proportions. However, every face shape has its own unique beauty and flattering hairstyles.

round.question: What is the best haircut for a round face?
round.answer: The best haircuts for round faces add height and angles. Long layers, side-swept bangs, and asymmetrical cuts work well. Avoid chin-length bobs that add width.

round.question: Should round faces have bangs?
round.answer: Side-swept or curtain bangs work great for round faces as they create angles. Avoid blunt, straight-across bangs that emphasize the roundness.

round.question: What hairstyles make a round face look thinner?
round.answer: Styles with volume at the crown, long layers, and side parts help elongate round faces. Avoid center parts and styles that add width at the cheeks.

round.question: Is short hair good for round faces?
round.answer: Yes, but choose the right short style. Pixie cuts with volume on top and longer pieces in front work well. Avoid very short, rounded bobs.

round.question: How can I make my round face look more oval?
round.answer: Add height at the crown, use side-swept styles, and keep hair longer around the face. Contouring makeup can also help create the illusion of a more oval shape.

square.question: What is the best hairstyle for a square face?
square.answer: Soft, layered cuts that soften angular features work best. Side-parted styles, waves, and curls complement square faces beautifully.

square.question: Should square faces avoid bangs?
square.answer: Not at all! Soft, wispy bangs or side-swept bangs can soften a square face. Avoid blunt, heavy bangs that emphasize the strong jawline.

square.question: What haircuts should square faces avoid?
square.answer: Avoid blunt, one-length cuts and very straight styles that emphasize angular features. Also avoid chin-length bobs that draw attention to the jaw.

square.question: Is long hair good for square faces?
square.answer: Yes! Long, layered hair with soft waves is excellent for square faces. It softens the jawline and adds feminine elegance.

square.question: How do I soften my square jawline with hair?
square.answer: Use soft layers around the face, waves or curls near the jaw, and side parts. Avoid tucking hair behind ears which exposes the jawline.

heart.question: What is the best haircut for a heart-shaped face?
heart.answer: Chin-length bobs, side-swept bangs, and styles with volume at the jaw level work best. These balance the wider forehead and narrow chin.

heart.question: Should heart faces have bangs?
heart.answer: Yes! Side-swept bangs are perfect for minimizing a wide forehead. Avoid heavy, full bangs that can make the forehead appear even wider.

heart.question: What hairstyles should heart faces avoid?
heart.answer: Avoid styles with lots of volume at the crown, slicked-back looks, and very short cuts that expose the wide forehead.

heart.question: Is a pixie cut good for heart-shaped faces?
heart.answer: It can be, but choose carefully. Pixie cuts with longer, side-swept pieces in front work well. Avoid very short, cropped styles.

heart.question: How can I balance my heart-shaped face?
heart.answer: Add volume and width at the chin level with layers or curls. Use side-swept bangs to minimize the forehead, and avoid top-heavy styles.

oblong.question: What is the best haircut for an oblong face?
oblong.answer: Styles with side volume, bangs, and chin to shoulder-length cuts work best. These add width and reduce the appearance of length.

oblong.question: Should oblong faces have bangs?
oblong.answer: Yes! Bangs are great for oblong faces as they shorten the face visually. Try curtain bangs, side-swept bangs, or even blunt bangs.

oblong.question: What hairstyles should oblong faces avoid?
oblong.answer: Avoid very long, straight hair and styles that add height at the crown. These can make the face appear even longer.

oblong.question: Is long hair bad for oblong faces?
oblong.answer: Very long hair can elongate the face further. Opt for chin to shoulder-length styles with layers and volume for best results.

oblong.question: How can I make my long face look shorter?
oblong.answer: Add width with layers and waves at the sides. Bangs help shorten the face visually. Avoid center parts and very long, straight styles.

diamond.question: What is the best haircut for a diamond face?
diamond.answer: Chin-length bobs, side-swept bangs, and styles with fullness at the forehead and chin work best. These balance the wide cheekbones.

diamond.question: Should diamond faces have bangs?
diamond.answer: Yes! Side-swept bangs add width to the narrow forehead. Avoid very short bangs that expose too much of the forehead.

diamond.question: What hairstyles should diamond faces avoid?
diamond.answer: Avoid slicked-back styles, very short hair, and styles that add volume at the cheekbones. These emphasize the widest part of the face.

diamond.question: Is a bob good for diamond faces?
diamond.answer: Yes! Chin-length bobs are excellent for diamond faces as they add fullness at the narrow chin while balancing the cheekbones.

diamond.question: How can I balance my diamond face shape?
diamond.answer: Add volume at the forehead with bangs and at the chin with layers. Keep hair smooth over the cheekbones to minimize their width.
